title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Cavaliers Rout Suns Behind Kemp's Monumental Performance**

PHOENIX — On a night destined for the record books, it was not a team that triumphed, but one man. Shawn Kemp delivered a performance of raw, unstoppable power, single-handedly dismantling the Phoenix Suns as his Cleveland Cavaliers cruised to a 102-84 victory.

From the opening tip, Kemp was an uncontainable force of nature. He wasn't just scoring; he was imposing his will, attacking the rim with a ferocity that left the Suns' defense in tatters. When the final buzzer sounded, the stat sheet told a story of historic dominance: a staggering 45 points, leaving every other player on the court in his statistical shadow.

This was more than a win; it was an exhibition. Kemp’s 45-point eruption wasn't just the game's headline—it *was* the game. Every Cavalier possession flowed through him, every play designed to unleash his unique blend of strength and athleticism against a helpless Phoenix frontcourt. The Suns, who had no answer, could only watch as he piled up points in bunches, turning a competitive contest into a one-man showcase.

While Cedric Henderson provided valuable support with 16 points, and Wesley Person and Derek Anderson chipped in 14 and 13 respectively, their contributions were footnotes to the Kemp saga. His dominance on the offensive glass, securing 12 rebounds, was merely an extension of his will.

For the Suns, the night was a forgettable blur. Cliff Robinson’s 20 points and Tom Gugliotta’s 15 were rendered meaningless in the face of Kemp’s storm. The Cavaliers didn't just beat the Suns; they provided the stage for a player at the absolute peak of his powers, a force who, for one magnificent night, was simply better than anyone else on the floor.
